pullRequest.title: Fix rule for aggregation through outer join pushdown

nodes.bodyText:
is using symbols name is confusing. It seems that if any symbol from source is being used, this method should return true. Please use different name, e.g
isAggregationOnSymbols

We want all aggregations to be from outer side exclusively, no?
Shouldn't this be:
!isUsingSymbols(aggregation, getOuterTable(join))

?
Also, didn't previous code deal with mixed aggregations?

this query passes before the change
nit: stuttered space

nodes.bodyText: This test creates necessary circumstances for the count(*) to be pushed down, but doesn't test it's being pushed. I think some explanation is useful, so do not remove. Reword.

nodes.bodyText:
If the aggregation has a hash symbol, it probably comes from the join's outer table (since aggregation is on outer table's outputs). But then, it's an additional output symbol and not grouping key of the aggregation, so the groupsOnAllColumns cannot be satisfied.
I think this rule doesn't have -- and doesn't have to have -- ambitions to handle hash symbols.
It's enough if it detects this situation and bails out.

commit.message:
Fix rule matching for Aggregation through Join pushdown

For successful pushdown of AggregationNode into JoinNode's source
it is required that all symbols used by Aggregations be present
in that source.
Before this change, it was not fully checked and thus an Aggregation
using multiple symbols could be incorrectly pushed down
to a source which didn't provide all the required symbols.

This change introduces a complete check for required symbols and moves
the check to earlier stage of rule application.

Do not pushdown Aggregation with multiple grouping sets

Before this change, the rule PushAggregationThroughOuterJoin
pushed Aggregation into the inner source of Join regardless
of the number of grouping sets. It was only checked that
grouping keys were equal to output symbols of the outer source
of Join. Pushdown is correct only when there'e a single grouping
set.

Example of incorrect pushdown:
- Aggregation
	count(*)
	grouping sets {a}, {b}
	- LEFT Join (a=c)
		- Values (a, b)
		  	 (1, 2)
		- Values (c)
		  	 (1)
was incorrectly transformed into
- LEFT Join (a=c)
	- Values (a, b)
	  	 (1, 2)
	- Aggregation
	  	count(*)
		single grouping set {c}
		- Values (c)
		  	 (1)

The result before rewrite has 2 rows; after rewrite it is 1 row.

Note: this correctness issue might never occur because
AggregationNode with multiple grouping sets has a GroupIdNode
below, and so the rule doesn't match.
Add check for Aggregation's hash symbol in a rule

afterCommit.message: Add check for Aggregation's hash symbol in a rule
